metadata.title: CVE-2018-10911 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the way dic_unserialize function of glusterfs does not handle negative key length values. An attacker could use this flaw to read memory from other locations into the stored dict value. It was discovered that GlusterFS incorrectly handled negative key length values. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information.

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.4-1').
